data.description: Fall 2026 - IT - Collegiate Associate Intern in GAC Savannah Unique Skills: Your Future Takes Flight at Gulfstream At Gulfstream, a proud division of General Dynamics, Collegiate Associates apply classroom learning to real-world challenges and gain valuable experience. You’ll work alongside skilled professionals in a culture built on integrity, pride, and excellence—preparing you for future success in the aerospace industry. Our corporate headquarters in Savannah, Georgia provides the ideal setting for your associate experience by combining professional opportunity with the charm of a historic coastal city. What You’ll Experience Real-world projects that make an impact Exposure to innovative practices Opportunities to build skills and professional connections Benefits Include Competitive pay Paid Time Off Housing stipend (if your permanent residence is more than 50 miles from Gulfstream) Medical coverage 401(k) match Collegiate networking event Principal Duties and Responsibilities: Codes and documents software programs in accordance with design specifications. Creates unit and integration test plans. Performs unit and integration testing. Participates in peer code reviews. Supports application deployment. Not specific to all roles but able to accommodate the best suited role of PM, Developer, BA analyst or QA Analyst in an agile project. Desired Skills: Good knowledge of information systems used to support manufacturing to include an understanding of integrated systems. Knowledge of IT system environments/platforms and development tools preferred. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, draw valid conclusions and provide solutions. Ability to interpret a variety of technical information. Experience with manual and automated testing preferred. Concepts of risk management, issue tracking, change management and requirements gathering preferred. Experience working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment is essential. Excellent planning, time management and organization skills. Professional experience in quality assurance software testing as part of the development process preferred. Precise attention to detail required. Good consulting, client relations skills and customer service orientation. Excellent written and verbal communication skills including presentation expertise. Education requirements: Must be currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree or higher in information technology, information systems, math, computer science, or a related curriculum. 3.0 GPA or higher and must include extracurricular activities that demonstrate use of interpersonal, teamwork, and leadership skills. Employer Expectations: Demonstrates acceptance of responsibility; shows pride in work performed; demonstrates flexibility in acceptance of assignments and schedules; maintains professional behavior and appearance; exhibits dependability. Please note that this job description may remain active until March 27, 2026. Interviews may be conducted before or after this date. Education and Experience Requirements Position Purpose:Start your journey today by joining our team for a career-building experience that utilizes your skills within a world-class organization.Job Description Principle Duties and Responsibilities:Essential Functions: Perform other duties as assigned.Other Requirements: Must be enrolled as a full-time student at the time of application and actively pursuing a bachelor’s degree or higher. Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher (unrounded); must be listed on resume. Minimum duration: 12–14 weeks (summer); 14–16 weeks (spring and fall). Must work onsite; this is not a remote position. Must have reliable transportation. This job requires one to be able to read, write, speak, and understand the English language.Additional Information Requisition Number: 230871 Category: Other Percentage of Travel: Up to 25% Shift: First Employment Type: Full-time Number of Openings: 4 Equal Opportunity Employer / Individuals with Disabilities / Protected Veterans Gulfstream does not provide work visa sponsorship for this position, unless the applicant is a currently sponsored Gulfstream employee. Gulfstream Aerospace Corporation, a wholly-owned subsidiary of General Dynamics (NYSE: GD), designs, develops, manufactures, markets, services and supports the world's most technologically-advanced business jet aircraft
